content: Singaporean parliamentary meeting The **8th Parliament of Singapore** was a meeting of the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore). Its first session commenced on 6 January 1992 and was prorogued on 6 December 1993. It commenced its second session on 10 January 1994 and was dissolved on 16 December 1996. The members of the 8th Parliament were elected in the [1991 general election](/wiki/1991_Singaporean_general_election). Parliament was controlled by a [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) majority, led by [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister) [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong) and his [cabinet](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore). The Speaker was [Tan Soo Khoon](/wiki/Tan_Soo_Khoon). The *de facto* [Leader of the Opposition](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore)) was [Chiam See Tong](/wiki/Chiam_See_Tong) until he resigned as secretary-general of the [Singapore Democratic Party](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party) on 17 May 1993, and was replaced by [Ling How Doong](/wiki/Ling_How_Doong), chairman of his party. At roughly five years, this term had the longest tenure in Singapore history. With [Ng Kah Ting](/wiki/Ng_Kah_Ting)'s departure, [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) became the last MP from the [inaugural Parliament](/wiki/1st_Parliament_of_Singapore) to remain in Parliament; he would eventually die in office in 2015. ## Officeholders - [**Speaker**](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore)**:** [Tan Soo Khoon](/wiki/Tan_Soo_Khoon) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - **[Deputy Speaker](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore#List_of_deputy_speakers):** - [Abdullah Tarmugi](/wiki/Abdullah_Tarmugi) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), until 30 June 1993 - Eugene Yap Giau Cheng ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), from 26 February 1993 - **[Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore):** [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [**Deputy Prime Minister**](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore)**:** - [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - [Ong Teng Cheong](/wiki/Ong_Teng_Cheong) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), until 1 September 1993 - [Tony Tan](/wiki/Tony_Tan) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)), from 1 August 1995 - [**Leader of the Opposition**](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore))**:** - [Chiam See Tong](/wiki/Chiam_See_Tong) ([SDP](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party)), until 17 May 1993 - [Ling How Doong](/wiki/Ling_How_Doong) ([SDP](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party)), from 17 May 1993 - [**Leader of the House**](/wiki/Leader_of_the_House_(Singapore)): [Wong Kan Seng](/wiki/Wong_Kan_Seng) ([PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)) - **[Party Whip of the People's Action Party](/wiki/Party_Whip_of_the_People%27s_Action_Party)**: [Lee Boon Yang](/wiki/Lee_Boon_Yang) - [**Deputy Party Whip of the People's Action Party**](/wiki/Party_Whip_of_the_People%27s_Action_Party#List_of_deputy_party_whips)**:** - [Ho Kah Leong](/wiki/Ho_Kah_Leong) - [Ong Chit Chung](/wiki/Ong_Chit_Chung), from 30
